attributes.action: Offer the population an opportunity to hold a vote on rejoining the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit cut UK GDP by around 4%, increased inflation, and harmed trade / public services. Exports to the EU fell over 15%, investment declined, and key sectors face skill shortages. As global tensions rise, strong international alliances are vital.

Polls now show a majority regret leaving. A whole generation was too young to vote but must live with the consequences.  The public deserves a fresh, informed choice that reflects today’s economic reality, global challenges, and generational views.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to give the public a chance to vote on rejoining the EU. The economic impact of leaving is clear, with trade barriers, labour shortages, and rising costs. Over 60% of voters now believe leaving was a mistake, and an entire generation missed out. We believe a revote is essential

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727964
